article_title: Hans von Spakovsky: Here Comes the 2014 Voter Fraud
article_text: In the past few months, a former police chief in Pennsylvania pleaded guilty to voter fraud in a town-council election. That fraud had flipped the outcome of a primary election. Former Connecticut legislator Christina Ayala has been indicted on 19 charges of voter fraud, including voting in districts where she didn’t reside. (She hasn’t entered a plea.) A Mississippi grand jury indicted seven individuals for voter fraud in the 2013 Hattiesburg mayoral contest, which featured voting by ineligible felons and impersonation fraud. A woman in Polk County, Tenn., was indicted on a charge of vote-buying—a practice that the...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Hans von Spakovsky writes that progressives and the Justice Department are doing all they can to stop improvements in election integrity.
twitter.title: Here Comes the 2014 Voter Fraud

article_summary:
In the past few months, a former police chief in Pennsylvania pleaded guilty to voter fraud in a town-council election.
A Mississippi grand jury indicted seven individuals for voter fraud in the 2013 Hattiesburg mayoral contest, which featured voting by ineligible felons and impersonation fraud.
Former Connecticut legislator Christina Ayala has been indicted on 19 charges of voter fraud, including voting in districts where she didn’t reside.
A woman in Polk County, Tenn., was indicted on a charge of vote-buying—a practice that the...
That fraud had flipped the outcome of a primary election.
